page.title: 17BRYNNA WELSH ASPECT
page.content: Even thou being in Wales there are few people who speak welsh fluently.We are taught welsh as one of our subjets in school.We gave out some questionaries and asked Do you speak welsh? the reply was out of 100 only 5 could speak welsh.We entertain the school on S.t Davids Day by singing,danceing and playing music and by telling poems.We have two colours in our school. One is Blue it stands for Cwic the other is Red it stands for Ewenni.These are some place names in Brynnau Brynna = Hills Mynydd = mountains Coed Bychan = tree wood Mynydd Coed Bynydd =small mountain wood. { BY SOPHIE JENKINS {+ {TRACEY THOMAS
